Package org.hs.generator

This Java code generating package is designed for both static and dynamic (especially interactive) clients.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
GExpression Subclasses of GConstruct wishing to serve as an expression must implement this interface to be integrated into the code structure.
GSourceFile.Log  
GStatement Subclasses of GConstruct wishing to serve as a statement must implement this interface to be integrated into the code structure.
 

Class Summary
GArrayAccess GArrayAccess represents an expression in which a base expression of array type is accessed with an int-valued expression in square brackets, e.g.:
GBinary GBinary represents an assortment of binary (i.e., two-sided) expressions which includes:
GBlock A GBlock represents {a block of code in braces}, separate from those blocks that are intrinsically attached to a loop or switch construct.
GBreak This class represents a break statement in the context of a conditional loop or switch statement.
GCast A type cast expression, consisting of an GExpression to cast and a GType to cast it to.
GCatch A catch clause of a try/catch/finally statement, consisting of a variable to catch and a block to execute under that condition.
GClass A class declaration.
GClassInit A class initializer block, which may be static.
GCode This class is kind of a cluge; it allows a block of text to be included in the GConstruct tree as a statement of Java code.
GComment A mutable block of Java style comment (non-javadoc).
GComparison A boolean comparison between two values, consisting of two GExpression`s and one of the following operators:
GConstruct The base class of all code constructs in this package, GConstruct allows comments to be attached to it, and provides facilities for copying and convenient reflection access.
GContinue A continue statement in the context of a conditional loop.
GDecoder This class serves as a router for the enormous interface at.dms.kjc.KjcVisitor.
GFor This class represents a for loop such as:
GGroup An expression delimited by parentheses, such as:
GIf An if statement, comprised of the expected condition expression, thenClause and elseClause.
GInstanceOf An instanceof expression, comprised of the expression to evaluate, and the type against which to check it.
GInterface A reference to an interface by classname.
GLiteral A literal expression, explicitly typed by the field type, and encoded with a java.lang.String.
GLoop An abstract base class for conditional loops.
GMethod A method definition.
GMethodCall A method call expression or statement.
GNew An constructor invocation through the keyword 'new', by classname and optionally including a subclass definition (in the case of an anonymous instance creation).
GNewArray An instantiation of an array; empty (with dimensions), or initialized.
GReference JLS 6.5.2 Reclassification of Contextually Ambiguous Names
GReturn A return statement.
GSourceFile A source file, as expected by a standard Java compiler.
GStepwise A stepwise operator, one of:
GSwitch A switch statement, using GSwitchLabelGroup for case labels.
GSwitchLabelGroup A set of confluent case labels in a switch statement.
GSynchronized A synchronized statement.
GThrow A throw statement.
GTry A try/catch/finally statement.
GType A very convoluded representation of types.
GTypeDeclaration A type declaration; i.e., a class or interface, or an inner class or interface.
GUnary A unary operation, one of:
GVariable This chameleonic class can represent a local variable, a class field, a parameter, or one of the keywords this, super, class, length.
GVariableList A list of GVariables all declared in a single statement.
GWhile A while or do loop.
 

Package org.hs.generator Description

This Java code generating package is designed for both static and dynamic (especially interactive) clients. The package structure is very simple: each subclass of the abstract GConstruct represents one or more Java code constructs by containing the corresponding representative class(es) from its compiler foundation. These classes fit together into a tree in direct parallel with the format of the language itself, much the same way a compiler builds its tree of code constructs during parsing operations. A .java source file is represented by the outermost class GSourceFile; see its documentation and follow its members into the depths of the Java language.

Compilation and .java source file printing are currently backed by the Kopi compiler KJC. Because this is a GPL licensed project, org.hs.generator must for the time being also fall under the GPL. In the future I plan to move it to another compiler with a more lenient license. The process should be simple and straightforward, so if you are interested in doing the same, please contact me for permission at bitwise@cablespeed.com.

The data members of almost all the classes in this package have been made public, so as to provide a broad base of access upon which the widest variety of client structure can be built. Also, this makes for especially concise and readable code-generating-code in the case of a static client. However, there is considerable risk involved: if you need notification of access to your generator foundation, you will have to wrap each GConstruct and provide accessors (or subclass them as such and require a policy of non-use for the public members).

For extremely dynamic environments, the class GConstruct provides a set of generic reflection accessors, set(String fieldname, Object value) and get(String fieldname, Object value). It is easy to trap calls to these methods in a subclass, but no listener hook is at present provided to directly monitor activity through this mechanism.
